name: A Kind of Prayer
text:
Wooden picnic bench/ Slowly encroached by shade/ Your planks are weathering,/ Varnish long stripped,/ Pollen dust layered./

Where termites gnawed you down,/ Youâ€™re starting to look more like the tree/ You once were, or would have become,/ Ridges of outer bark,/ Smoothed and splintered,/ Bespidered,/ Base wreathed in the vertebrate husks of pine leaves./

Carefully sat, in spots,/ You can still support a body./
